title: House Manager Guide: Selling Your Employer's Wine and Spirits
metaTitle: House Manager Guide: Selling Your Employer's Wine and Spirits | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: A guide for house managers selling wine and spirits on behalf of an employer. Covers authorization, privacy, logistics, and the texting workflow.
summary: House managers often handle sales of household assets on behalf of employers. This guide covers how to sell wine and spirits efficiently while maintaining privacy and proper authorization.

sections.heading: What to Do Next
content: Confirm you have authorization to sell. This typically means written or verbal approval from the employer or their representative.
Our texting workflow works well for busy house managers. Text photos to 213-770-9463 and we handle research and valuation from there.
list: Confirm authorization from the employer
Photograph bottles in the cellar or storage area
Text photos to 213-770-9463 or submit through our form
We provide an offer for the employer to review
Coordinate logistics at a time that works for the household

sections.heading: What Information Matters for Pricing
content: Photos are often the fastest way to get us the information we need. We can research and identify bottles from clear photos.
list: Clear photos of labels
Quantities visible in photos or noted separately
Storage location (cellar, wine room, refrigerator)
Any original cases or boxes
Employer preferences on timing or logistics

sections.heading: Common Mistakes to Avoid
content: Starting a sale without clear authorization can create problems. Confirm with the employer before submitting.
Moving bottles before photos can make it harder to document what exists and where.
list: Proceeding without employer authorization
Moving bottles before documenting
Scheduling pickup without employer approval
Discarding boxes or packaging without checking value
Sharing employer information unnecessarily

sections.heading: How the Process Works
content: We work with house managers to minimize disruption to the household.
list: Text photos to 213-770-9463 or submit through our form
We research and provide a written offer
Share the offer with the employer for approval
If accepted, schedule pickup at a convenient time
Payment is issued to the employer after verification

sections.heading: Privacy and Safety Notes
content: We handle all communications confidentially. Employer names and addresses are not shared publicly.
Pickup can be scheduled around household schedules. We work with whatever logistics make sense.
All documentation is provided to the house manager or directly to the employer as preferred.

faqs.question: How do I get authorization?
faqs.answer: Confirm with your employer that they want to sell and that you are authorized to handle the process. Written confirmation is helpful but not always required.

faqs.question: Can I text photos instead of using the form?
faqs.answer: Yes. Text photos to 213-770-9463. This is often the fastest way. We follow up with any questions.

faqs.question: Who receives payment?
faqs.answer: Payment is issued to the authorized seller, typically the employer. We confirm payment details with whoever is managing the transaction.

faqs.question: How do we schedule pickup?
faqs.answer: We coordinate timing with you. Pickup can be scheduled around household schedules, deliveries, or other activities.

faqs.question: What if I do not know anything about wine?
faqs.answer: No problem. Photograph labels clearly and we identify everything. You do not need wine knowledge.

faqs.question: Is the employer's name disclosed?
faqs.answer: No. We handle transactions confidentially. Employer names are not published or shared.
